title: Football fans warned to beware of fake ticket scams
description: The return of the Premier League could see fraudsters trick devoted fans out of hundreds of pounds.

title: CEO Secrets: Hard Rock Cafe boss on the shift he'll never forget
description: Jim Allen, CEO of Hard Rock Cafe, shares a formative experience for our CEO Secrets series.

title: Kentucky floods: 'Guardian angel' saves family from deluge
description: Dramatic footage shows a man braving rapids to rescue an elderly pair from their home.

title: Commonwealth Games: Adam Peaty wins first 50m Commonwealth title
description: Adam Peaty says he has his "spark" back after powering to a first Commonwealth 50m breaststroke title in what he says is his final race at the Games.

title: Ukraine war: Russia says US involved and farmers report stolen seeds
description: Russia accused the US of approving missile targets, while Russian soldiers steal sunflower seeds.

title: Commonwealth Games: Gold for Scotland in Para-lawn bowls men's pairs B6-B8
description: Scotland overcome a controversial build-up to the Commonwealth Games to beat Australia and win gold in the Para-lawn bowls men's pairs B6-B8.

title: Snorkeler suffers 'suspected shark bite'
description: The "extremely rare" incident is believed to have involved a blue shark off the coast of Cornwall.

title: Princess Charlotte joins Duke and Duchess at Commonwealth Games
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge were in the crowd for swimming, hockey and gymnastic events.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Alice Kinsella wins gold in women's floor
description: Watch as England's Alice Kinsella wins the women's floor gold medal, with fellow Englishwoman Ondine Achampong taking silver, at the Commonwealth Games.

title: Archie Battersbee: Who decides when life support ends?
description: Tragically, for a small number of children who become critically ill each year, medicine reaches its limits.

title: Commonwealth Games: Jake Jarman claims fourth gymnastics gold to break record
description: Jake Jarman completes a superb Commonwealths debut with a fourth gold medal to become the most successful English male gymnast at a single Games.

title: Record broken as woman, 21, conquers K2
description: Adriana Brownlee has now climbed 10 of the world's 14 highest peaks - but wants to conquer more.

title: Kosovo: Why is trouble flaring between Serbs and the Albanian-led government?
description: Serbs have been demonstrating in Kosovo, raising fears of renewed ethnic hostilities.

title: Mock the Week: BBC Two's comedy panel show to end after 17 years

title: Ukraine war: How Russia uses social media to steal sunflower seeds
description: Crops are being brought from occupied parts of Ukraine to Russia, farmers tell BBC News.

title: China-Taiwan: Why young people in Taiwan are learning to fight
description: As the island's politicians prepare to meet the US house speaker, others learn warfare survival.

title: Bridgend: 'Serious concerns' with children's services
description: "Urgent action" is needed in the area where five-year-old Logan Mwangi was murdered by his family.

title: BP sees biggest profit in 14 years as energy bills soar
description: The firm's profits between April and June more than tripled as oil and gas prices jumped.

title: Tory leadership: Liz Truss backtracks on public worker pay plan
description: A plan to link public sector pay to location was strongly criticised by Labour and some Conservatives.

title: How the US found al-Qaeda's top man
description: After more than 20 years on the run, al-Qaeda boss Ayman al-Zawahiri died in a US drone strike on Sunday.

title: How can England's Euro 2022 win help grow the game?
description: Improving attendances and tackling inequalities over pay, prize money, coverage and sponsorship will be no quick-fix, reports BBC sports editor Dan Roan.

title: Archie Battersbee: Family appeals to Supreme Court over life-support withdrawal
description: The Court of Appeal had said treatment of the 12-year-old should come to an end by midday.

title: China-Taiwan: Tensions spike ahead of Pelosi's expected visit
description: Taiwan says it has a full grasp of nearby military activity, China says US will "pay the price".

title: Big Brother will return next year on ITV2 and online
description: The ground-breaking reality show was ultimately axed by both Channel 4 and Channel 5.

title: BTS could perform while doing military service
description: The oldest member of the K-pop band turns 30 next year so the issue has come into focus in South Korea.

title: Jamal Edwards: Cocaine sparked death of entrepreneur, coroner concludes
description: A toxicology report finds evidence of cocaine use, which probably caused the entrepreneur's death.

title: Channel Migrants: New daily high for 2022 set on Monday
description: Almost 700 migrants crossed the English Channel in 14 boats on Monday, the Ministry of Defence says.

title: Pornhub: Judge rules Visa can be sued in abuse claim
description: A woman who was thirteen when an explicit video of her was posted, is suing Mindgeek and Visa.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Wales win gold in men's pair bowls
description: Watch the moment Wales win gold in the men's pair bowls as they beat England 19-18 at the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham.

title: US Capitol riots: How many have been charged with crimes?
description: The police investigation into the storming of Congress is one of the biggest in US history.

title: House prices climb 11% despite cost of living squeeze

title: Ayman al-Zawahiri: Al-Qaeda leader killed in US drone strike
description: Ayman al-Zawahiri helped plan the 9/11 attacks and was among America's most wanted men.

description: China sees Taiwan as a breakaway province, but many Taiwanese people want a separate nation.

title: Bitcoin: Missing hard drive could fund Newport crypto hub

description: Sir Thomas Picton's portrait now stands in a box along with works from Trinidadian artists.

title: Ayman al-Zawahiri: Who was al-Qaeda leader killed by US?
description: A former eye surgeon from Egypt, he took over the terror network after the killing of Osama Bin Laden in 2011.

description: New figures show the trend of UK club closures continued despite government support.
